document.masterDocTitle: Oribatid mites (Acari: Oribatida) recorded from Ireland: Catalogue, historical records, species habitats and geographical distribution, combinations, variations and synonyms

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Oribatid mites (Acari: Oribatida) recorded from Ireland: Catalogue, historical records, species habitats and geographical distribution, combinations, variations and synonyms

bibRefCitation.author: Hull
bibRefCitation.refString: Hull, J. E. (1916) Terrestrial Acari of the Tyne province. Transactions of the Natural History Society Northumberland, 4, 381 - 423.

subSubSection.paragraph:
·
Adoristes ovatus (C.L. Koch, 1839)
*

· Original name:
Oribata ovatus C.L. Koch, 1839
.
· In: Deutschlands Crustaceen, Myriapoden und Arachniden, Vol. 30 (24).

·
Adoristes poppei (Oudemans, 1906)
*

· Original name:
Liacarus poppei Oudemans, 1906
.
· In: Nachtrag zur Milben-Fauna der Umgegend Bremens. Abhandlungen herausgegeben vom

· Historical combinations/variations:
Adoristes ovatus poppei (Oudemans) Pérez-Íñigo, 1970
;
Adoristes

( Adoristes ) poppei (Oudemans) Subías, 2004
.
Counties: Clare , Cork , Galway , Kildare , Kilkenny , Laois , Limerick , Mayo , Offaly , Tipperary , Wexford and Wicklow .

·
Liacarus ( Dorycranosus ) acutus
Pschorn-Walcher, 1951

· Original name:
Liacarus acutus Pshorn-Walcher, 1951
.
· In : Bonner zoologische Beiträge , 2 (1–2), 181.

· Historical combinations/variations:
Dorycranosus acutus (Pschorn-Walcher)
Arroyo et al ., 2015
.

·
Liacarus ( Liacarus ) coracinus
(C.L. Koch, 1841)
*

· Original name:
Oribata coracinus C.L. Koch, 1871
.
· In: Deutschlands Crustaceen, Myriapoden und Arachniden, Vol. 31 (1).

· Historical combinations/variations:
Leiosoma coracinum (C.L. Koch) Berlese, 1885
;
Liacarus coracinus (C.L. Koch) Sellnick, 1928
.

·
Liacarus ( Liacarus ) nitens
(Gervais, 1844)

· Original name:
Oribata nitens Gervais, 1844
.

· In: Aceres, Phryneides, Scorpionides, Solpugides, Phalangides et Acarides; etc. pp.
132–260 in
C.A. Walckenaer (Ed.), Histoire Naturelle des Insectes. Apteres , Vol. 3, 259.

· Historical combinations/variations:
Leiosoma nitens (Gervais) Nicolet, 1855
;
Notaspis nitens (Gervais) Michael, 1898
;
Liacarus nitens (Gervais) Willmann, 1931
.

· Synonyms:
Liacarus robustus Ewing, 1918
.

paragraph.materialsCitation: Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Fungal sporocarps ( O’Connell 1994 ). Counties: Kilkenny .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Liacarus ( Liacarus ) xylariae
(Schrank, 1803)
*

· Original name:
Acarus xylariae Schrank, 1803
.

· In: Fauna Boica.
Durchgedachte Geschichte der in Bayern einheimischen und zahmen Thiere
. Bd. 3 Abt. 1, Philipp Krüll, Landshut, 272 pp.

· Historical combinations/variations:
Liacarus xylariae (Schrank) Borcard, 1992
.
Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Agricultural grassland ( Curry 1969a ; Valarasan 1971 ). Counties: Dublin and Kildare.

·
Xenillus tegeocranus (Hermann, 1804)
*

· Original name:
Notaspis tegeocranus Hermann, 1804
.
· In: Mémoire Aptérologique . Strassbourg. 154 pp, 93.

· Synonyms:
Cepheus bifidatus Nicolet, 1855
;
Cepheus vulgaris Nicolet, 1855
;
Xenillus clypeator Sellnick, 1960
.
